thread.title: Waukegan teen charged with shooting woman in Zion - Lake County News-Sun
thread.title_full: Waukegan teen charged with shooting woman in Zion - Lake County News-Sun

author: Frank Abderholden
title: Waukegan teen charged with shooting woman in Zion - Lake County News-Sun
text:
A Waukegan 17-year-old is being held on $1 million bond on charges that he shot a North Chicago woman at 2 a.m. Saturday in Zion.
Officers were responding to a call about a loud party in the 1900 block of Joanna Avenue around 2 a.m. when dispatchers received a second 911 call about shots fired just a few blocks away at 21st Street and Joanna Avenue, according to a statement from Zion police.
The victim, a 21-year-old woman who suffered a non-life threatening gunshot wound, was located near a gas station on the 2100 block of Lewis Avenue, police said. She was taken by Zion Fire Department personnel to Vista Medical Center East in Waukegan.
Marshon D. Knox, a 17-year-old who is being charged as an adult in connection with the shooting, was arrested after authorities found him with an injury to his hand on the 2000 block of Joanna Avenue, police said. According to police, he also was taken by ambulance to the hospital before investigators determined he was responsible for the shooting.
Knox is charged with aggravated battery with a firearm, a class X felony, and aggravated discharge of a firearm, a class 1 felony. He was taken to bond court and then to the Depke Juvenile Justice Center in Vernon Hills.
Police said there were no other victims and the gun was not recovered.
